action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow in the refrigerator, the book in the wardrobe and the plate on the shelf.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a living room now. There are a side table, a couch, a table and a chair. There is a passage to a hallway here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a living room, a broom closet and a bedroom here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard and a counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a pantry and a hallway here.
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there are a book and a plate.
You take the book. In your inventory you have a book.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a book and a plate.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a living room, a broom closet and a bedroom here.
You are in a bedroom now. There are a bed and a wardrobe. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
The wardrobe is now open. In the wardrobe there is a pillow.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
You can't go to a living room from here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a living room, a broom closet and a bedroom here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard and a counter. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a pantry and a hallway here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
You are in a pantry now. There are a refrigerator and a freezer. The refrigerator is closed. The freezer is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a apple, a peach, a orange, a sandwich and a banana.
You can't go to a hallway from here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard and a counter. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a pantry and a hallway here.
You can't see a pillow here.
You can't go to a bedroom from here.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a bed, a wardrobe and a pillow. The wardrobe is open. The pillow is in the wardrobe. There is a passage to a hallway here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
